content.question:
Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.)

The images show three different views of the same work.

Using two examples of specific visual evidence, explain how this work demonstrates continuity with established artistic traditions.

Using two examples of specific visual evidence, explain how this work demonstrates change from established artistic traditions.

Using two examples of specific contextual evidence, explain why the work integrates elements from multiple artistic traditions.

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.2: Interactions Within and Across Cultures in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain why a specific work of art (or group of related works of art) demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
